p: The specific modeling of the active force influences the structure of a single cluster as shown in the insets of Fig. 1, panels (c), (d), for ABP and AOUP, respectively. In particular, ABP’s arrange in ring-like clusters while AOUP’s form Gaussian-like clusters as in the passive case ( U 0 = 0). In Fig. 2c) the radial probability distribution, ρ( r), of a single cluster is numerically measured. ρ( r) dr is the fraction of particles of a cluster which are at a distance between r and r + dr from its center. In particular, ρ( r) = 2 πrp( x), where p( x) is the single-particle probability density for a specific particle to be at x, which turns out to depend only on the norm r = | x|.
